page.title: 11WORK OUTSIDE THE VILLAGES
page.content: Farming,gravel extraction,concrete manufacture and the research station don't employ many people,and some of those travel from outside. Inevitably,these days,there is some local unemployment but it is probably lower than the area's average. It can be seen,therefore,that the bulk of the{workers}must work{outside} the{villages.}They travel to{Newark, {Southwell,}and,especially,{Nottingham} and all over the area.They span all the socio-economic classes and do{all {kinds of work.}They travel by rail and especially by car.There is a steady stream of road traffic out each morn- ing which,converging with other traffic,helps to create the morning rush hour,especially towards Nottm. The roads may be slow but they are there and not unpleasant.And what luck to have a decent rail service!
